document_title: Nasopharyngeal cancer: Causes, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
When it comes to nasopharyngeal cancer, symptoms rarely appear in the early stages. In the locally advanced or late stages of the disease, patients often have one or more of the following symptoms:
Mouth pain or bleeding; Sore throat; Difficulty swallowing; Hoarseness; Prolonged cough or coughing up blood; Ear pain, decreased hearing or tinnitus; Nasal congestion, prolonged nosebleeds; Blurred vision, double vision or crossed eyes; There is a tumor/lymph node in the neck
See more: Signs of nasopharyngeal cancer are easy to recognize and should not be ignored.
Lumps/lymph nodes in the neck are the most common sign of the disease
However, the above symptoms may be manifestations of other head and neck diseases, less serious than nasopharyngeal cancer. Therefore, if you have any of the above signs, see your doctor for examination and accurate diagnosis.
